actor_awards.notes: Lawford received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame at 6920 Hollywood Blvd. He won Photoplay Awards for Best Performance for his roles in 'It Happened in Brooklyn' (1947) and 'Julia Misbehaves' (1948).

filmography.title: Ocean's 11
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, stylish member of Danny Ocean's team whose mother is the intended target's fiancée, complicating the heist logistics.
filmography.plot: Danny Ocean gathers a group of his World War II compatriots to pull off the ultimate Las Vegas heist: robbing five casinos simultaneously on New Year's Eve.

filmography.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
filmography.role_description: A decent, upright young man who is a suitor to Gladys Hallward and stands as a moral contrast to the corrupt and hedonistic Dorian Gray.
filmography.plot: A corrupt young man somehow keeps his youthful beauty eternally, but a special painting gradually reveals his inner ugliness to all.

filmography.title: Easter Parade
filmography.role_description: The wealthy, well-meaning best friend of Don Hewes (Fred Astaire) who inadvertently complicates Don's romantic life by falling for his former partner.
filmography.plot: A nightclub performer hires a naive chorus girl to become his new partner to make his former partner jealous and prove he can make a star out of anyone.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Music (Scoring of a Musical Picture)

filmography.title: The Longest Day
filmography.role_description: The eccentric, sweater-wearing British commando leader who marches his men onto Sword Beach accompanied by his personal bagpiper.
filmography.plot: The events of D-Day, told on a grand scale from both the Allied and German points of view.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Cinematography, Best Special Effects

filmography.title: Little Women
filmography.role_description: The charming, lonely boy next door who becomes the best friend of the March sisters, particularly Jo, before eventually marrying Amy.
filmography.plot: The four March sisters grow up in New England during the Civil War, facing love, loss, and the transition to womanhood.

filmography.title: Good News
filmography.role_description: A popular college football hero who struggles with his French class and falls for his tutor while trying to impress a snobbish transfer student.
filmography.plot: A football hero falls for a studious girl who is tutoring him so he can pass his grades and play in the big game.

filmography.title: Royal Wedding
filmography.role_description: A dashing British nobleman who romances an American dancer (Jane Powell) in London during the festivities of Princess Elizabeth's wedding.
filmography.plot: A brother and sister dance act travel to London for the Royal Wedding and both find romance.

filmography.title: Advise & Consent
filmography.role_description: A charismatic, womanizing young Senator from Rhode Island (loosely based on JFK) who navigates the treacherous political landscape of Washington.
filmography.plot: A controversial Senate investigation into the President's nominee for Secretary of State uncovers blackmail and secrets that threaten to destroy careers.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nominated – Palme d'Or

filmography.title: It Should Happen to You
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, soap-manufacturing playboy who romances a woman seeking fame (Judy Holliday) but doesn't quite understand her need for validation.
filmography.plot: A woman determined to make a name for herself rents a billboard in Columbus Circle, attracting the attention of a documentary filmmaker and a wealthy businessman.

filmography.title: Exodus
filmography.role_description: A rigid, anti-Zionist British officer stationed in Cyprus who clashes with the Jewish refugees and their leaders.
filmography.plot: The state of Israel is created in 1948, leading to war with its Arab neighbors.

filmography.title: Son of Lassie
filmography.role_description: The grown-up owner of Lassie's son, Laddie, who becomes an RAF flyer and is shot down over Nazi-occupied Norway with his loyal dog.
filmography.plot: Lassie's son Laddie stows away on a bomber with his master and they must parachute into enemy territory in Norway.

filmography.title: Salt and Pepper
filmography.role_description: One half of a hip London nightclub owning duo (with Sammy Davis Jr.) who get caught up in a spy plot involving a plan to overthrow the government.
filmography.plot: Two Soho nightclub owners find themselves in trouble when a secret agent is murdered in their club.

filmography.title: One More Time
filmography.role_description: In this sequel directed by Jerry Lewis, Lawford plays dual roles: the club owner and his aristocratic twin brother who is murdered.
filmography.plot: Chris Pepper assumes the identity of his murdered twin brother to solve the crime, dragging his partner Charlie Salt into the mystery.

filmography.title: Dead Ringer
filmography.role_description: The cynical, opportunist lover of the murdered twin sister who discovers the identity switch and blackmails the survivor.
filmography.plot: A wealthy woman is murdered by her twin sister, who then assumes her identity, only to find that her sister's life was full of dark secrets.

filmography.title: Julia Misbehaves
filmography.role_description: A handsome young artist who falls in love with the daughter of the title character, giving Elizabeth Taylor her first on-screen kiss.
filmography.plot: A showgirl mother returns to her estranged wealthy husband's estate for her daughter's wedding, causing chaos and romance.

filmography.title: The White Cliffs of Dover
filmography.role_description: The son of an American woman and a British aristocrat who grows up to fight for England in World War II.
filmography.plot: An American woman marries a British baronet and lives through two world wars, losing her husband and fearing for her son.

filmography.title: Never So Few
filmography.role_description: A medical officer assigned to an OSS detachment in Burma who works alongside Frank Sinatra and Steve McQueen.
filmography.plot: An OSS commander leads a group of American and British soldiers and Kachin guerrillas against the Japanese in Burma.

filmography.title: Buona Sera, Mrs. Campbell
filmography.role_description: One of three American ex-servicemen who have been paying child support to an Italian woman for 20 years, believing he is the father.
filmography.plot: Three American men return to an Italian village for a reunion, each believing he is the father of a local woman's daughter.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best English-Language Foreign Film

filmography.title: A Yank at Eton
filmography.role_description: A snobbish upperclassman at Eton College who bullies the new American student, played by Mickey Rooney.
filmography.plot: A brash young American is sent to school in England where he clashes with traditions and the other students.

filmography.title: Cluny Brown
filmography.role_description: A young British gentleman who unwittingly becomes part of the romantic entanglements surrounding a plumber's niece.
filmography.plot: A plumber's niece with a penchant for plumbing is sent to work as a servant at an English country estate.

filmography.title: The April Fools
filmography.role_description: The manipulative boss who invites his employee to a party, unknowingly setting him up with his own unhappy wife.
filmography.plot: A Wall Street broker and his boss's wife fall in love and decide to run away together during a chaotic party.

filmography.title: Please Believe Me
filmography.role_description: A millionaire bachelor who is one of three men pursuing a woman they mistakenly believe is a wealthy heiress.
filmography.plot: A British woman inherits a Texas ranch and is pursued by a fortune hunter, a millionaire, and a lawyer on a transatlantic voyage.

filmography.title: Just This Once
filmography.role_description: A carefree millionaire playboy whose spending habits lead a judge to appoint a frugal female lawyer to manage his finances.
filmography.plot: A spendthrift millionaire has his accounts frozen and is put on a strict allowance by a beautiful but stern attorney.

filmography.title: The Red Danube
filmography.role_description: A British officer stationed in Vienna who falls in love with a Russian ballerina trying to avoid repatriation.
filmography.plot: British officials in post-WWII Vienna deal with the repatriation of refugees while trying to protect a ballerina from the Soviets.

filmography.title: They Only Kill Their Masters
filmography.role_description: The ex-husband of a murder victim in a coastal town, who becomes a person of interest in the investigation.
filmography.plot: A police chief investigates the murder of a woman found dead on a beach, with her Doberman Pinscher the prime suspect.

filmography.title: Sylvia
filmography.role_description: A wealthy man who hires a private investigator to look into the past of his mysterious fiancée.
filmography.plot: A private eye hired to investigate the background of a millionaire's fiancée discovers her sordid past and falls in love with her.

filmography.title: You for Me
filmography.role_description: A millionaire sportsman who is accidentally shot by a nurse while hunting, leading to a romantic entanglement.
filmography.plot: A wealthy playboy falls for the nurse who accidentally shot him in the rear, but she is also pursued by a doctor.
